TEXT: The applicant is a NORP national , born in DATE and living in GPE . He is an interpreter and translator ( NORP / NORP ) by profession .
A.
I. Procedure relating to ORG list of registered interpreters
On DATE the applicant applied to the President of ORG ( PERSON für PERSON ) to be entered on this court ’s list of registered interpreters ( allgemein beeidete PERSON ) for the NORP language .

On DATE the President of ORG , referring to sections DATE ) of ORG LAW DATE ( Bundesgesetz über den allgemein beeideten gerichtlichen PERSON ) , dismissed this request on the ground that the applicant was entered on ORG list of registered interpreters . The President noted that the decision of the President of ORG dated DATE , namely to strike the applicant off that court ’s list of registered interpreters , had not yet become final .
On DATE the applicant again applied with the President of ORG to be entered on this court ’s list of registered interpreters for the NORP language .
On DATE the President of ORG , referring to sections CARDINAL and CARDINAL ) of ORG LAW DATE , dismissed this request on the ground that there was no need for registered interpreters .

On DATE ORG Verfassungsgerichtshof ) granted the applicant ’s request for legal aid and counsel was appointed to represent the applicant for the purposes of complaint proceedings . Counsel filed the complaint with ORG on DATE , alleging in particular discrimination and a violation of the freedom to practise a profession .

In his observations of DATE , the President of ORG stated that the need for registered interpreters was known to the President keeping the lists concerned due to his regular contacts with the judges of ORG and of ORG , and judges of other courts in the respective judicial district . Extensive inquiries were therefore not necessary . No suggestions for more registered interpreters had been made prior to the applicant ’s application . Moreover , the keeping and updating of these lists required a considerable amount of administrative work which indicated that not all persons fulfilling the statutory conditions should be entered on the respective lists . The President also noted that a registered interpreter did not have any privileges compared to an unregistered interpreter , as any competent person could be called in concrete proceedings to act as an expert or interpreter . Any person speaking a foreign language could practise as an interpreter without registration , irrespective of whether he or she were appointed , on a case by case basis , by courts or administrative authorities , or were working as a free lance translator . Moreover , the question of registration did not affect the occupation as an employed translator .

In his supplementary observations of DATE , the applicant submitted that the handling of applications for registrations in DATE disclosed arbitrariness on the part of the President of ORG . He further maintained that registered interpreters were given preference upon appointment for court proceedings and that the lack of registration also had repercussions when otherwise practising as interpreter .

On DATE , pursuant to LAW , ORG declined to accept the applicant 's complaint . It found that the bulk of the complaint related to allegations that the ordinary law had been applied incorrectly . To the extent that the complaint did touch upon questions of constitutional law , it did not have sufficient prospects of success ; moreover , the case did not lie outside the jurisdiction of ORG ( Verwaltungsgerichtshof ) . At the applicant ’s request , it also decided to refer the application to ORG .

On DATE ORG stayed the proceedings before it as the applicant ’s application did not satisfy the substantive and formal requirements of section GPE ) of LAW ( Verwaltungsgerichtshofsgesetz ) . The applicant ’s amended submissions were received at ORG on DATE . He also applied for legal aid ; his request was to no avail .

On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s appeal . It observed that , in accordance with LAW , its jurisdiction was limited to applications alleging that a final administrative decision ( letztinstanzlicher PERSON ) had infringed the complainant ’s rights . An administrative decision within the meaning of this provision presupposed that the handling of an administrative matter had involved a legal ruling . This had not been the case for the impugned letter of CARDINAL DATE as , under section CARDINAL ) , in conjunction with section CARDINAL , of ORG LAW DATE , persons applying for entry on the list of registered interpreters had no right to registration . The refusal of registration could not , therefore , adversely affect the applicant ’s legal status , nor had there been a decision on the applicant ’s rights . Rather , the President had sent an informal reply ( formlose GPE ) to the applicant ’s application .
This decision was served on DATE .
II . Procedure concerning ORG list of registered interpreters

On DATE the applicant , who had been struck off ORG list of registered interpreters by the President ’s decision of CARDINAL DATE as ORG was not his regular place of residence and practice , applied to be restored to the ORG list . In his application , he mentioned that there was a need for registered interpreters for the NORP language , as , on several occasions , he had been called to act as interpreter , registered interpreters not being available .
On DATE the President of ORG dismissed the request .

On DATE , pursuant to LAW , ORG declined to accept the applicant 's complaint of DATE . It found that the bulk of the complaint related to allegations that the ordinary law had been applied incorrectly . To the extent that the complaint did touch upon questions of constitutional law , it did not have sufficient prospects of success ; moreover , the case did not lie outside the jurisdiction of ORG . At the applicant ’s request , it also decided to refer the application to ORG .

On DATE ORG stayed the proceedings before it as the applicant ’s application did not satisfy the substantive and formal requirements of section GPE ) of LAW . The applicant ’s amended submissions were received at ORG on DATE .
On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s appeal for the same reasons as stated in the above - mentioned decision of CARDINAL DATE .
B. Relevant domestic law
CARDINAL . Registered interpreters

The qualifications of registered interpreters ( allgemein beeidete gerichtliche PERSON ) are specified in ORG and LAW DATE ( Bundesgesetz über den allgemein beeideten gerichtlichen PERSON , PERSON ORG . CARDINAL ) . According to section LAW , the provisions regarding experts ( sections CARDINAL ) are also applicable to interpreters , with the exception of section CARDINAL ) b and f ( requiring a minimum period of professional experience and NORP nationality ) .

Section CARDINAL lays down the conditions for registration in the lists to be kept by the presidents of the courts of first instance ( i.e. at the level of the regional courts - section CARDINAL ) . Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL)(CARDINAL ) concerns the personal qualifications such as special knowledge ( PERSON ) , full capacity to perform legal transactions ( volle Geschäftsfähigkeit ) , physical and mental fitness ( körperliche und geistige PERSON ) , trustworthiness ( PERSON ) , regular residence or place of professional activity ( gewöhnlicher PERSON oder LOC beruflichen ORG ) in the judicial district of the court where registration is sought , and financially sound circumstances . According to section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) , there must be a need for registered experts ( interpreters ) .

Section CARDINAL governs the registration procedure . The possibility of registration is limited to CARDINAL list . The candidate has to prove his or her qualifications and the president has to conduct all necessary inquiries and , if necessary , to question the candidate . According to the third sentence of section PERSON ) , the candidate has no right to be entered on the list .

The oath taken in accordance with section CARDINAL ) has the legal effect that the expert or interpreter , as long as he or she is registered , does not have to take any specific oath when acting in court ( section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) ) .

The respective lists are regularly updated ( DATE ) and communicated to the president of the superior court of appeal and subsequently to the courts in the judicial district concerned ( section CARDINAL ) . Sections CARDINAL to CARDINAL concern the expiration of registration and striking off the list .
CARDINAL . Procedure before ORG and ORG

By LAW , ORG , when an application ( Beschwerde ) is made to it , has to determine whether an administrative decision ( Bescheid ) has infringed a right guaranteed by the LAW or has applied regulations ( Verordnung ) contrary to the law , a law contrary to LAW or an international treaty incompatible with NORP law .
By LAW , ORG has jurisdiction to hear , inter alia , applications alleging that an administrative decision is unlawful .

Section CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) of LAW ( Verwaltungsgerichtshofsgesetz ) provides inter alia that applications upon which , on account of ORG manifest lack of jurisdiction , it is not appropriate to adjudicate , shall be rejected , without further proceedings , by a decision taken in closed sitting .
